intro: Eriogonum brevicaule, commonly known as the short-stemmed buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has small, oval leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum brevicaule is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in sagebrush steppe and grassland habitats.
